description: From Latin tergiversor (“turn one's back, make excuses”); from tergum (“the back”) + versō, frequentative of vertō (“turn”).

verbs.description: tergiversate (third-person singular simple present tergiversates, present participle tergiversating, simple past and past participle tergiversated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To evade, to equivocate using subterfuge; to obfuscate in a deliberate manner.
(intransitive) To change sides or affiliation; to apostatize.
(intransitive, rare) To flee by turning one's back.
